hints.content:
In this fact family, the $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{30}$.

The $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD3$.

The $\maroonD{\text{size of each group}}$ is $\maroonD{10}$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A tape diagram with 2 tapes of equal lengths. The first tape is labeled 30 and the second tape with 3 equal parts each labeled 10. A curved bracket across the bottom and the width of the second tape is labeled with the words 3 equal groups. !

options.explanation:
The factors can change order without changing the total.

So, we can also represent the image with different multiplication and division equations: 

- $\purpleC{30} \div \greenD3 = \maroonD{10}$
- $\greenD3 \times \maroonD{10} = \purpleC{30}$

The $=$ symbol simply means, "is the same as." So these equations mean the same thing, too.

- $\purpleC{30}= \maroonD{10} \times \greenD{3}$
-  $\greenD{3} = \purpleC{30}\div\maroonD{10}$

question.content:
**Which equations can the tape diagram represent?**
